DOC.brief_title: Randomized Trial Tailored Dietary Advice Lower Blood Pressure
DOC.detailed_description: Unhealthy diet many social determinant ; however , markedly low availability component DASH diet-recommended food ( fresh fruit vegetable , skim milk whole grain food ) predominantly African-American lower-income neighborhood compare Caucasian higher-income neighborhood . Unhealthy dietary consumption pattern contribute , part , hypertension deficiency potassium , magnesium vitamin C - micronutrient independent blood pressure-lowering effect . Furthermore , use thiazide-based antihypertensive therapy often worsen deficiency increase urinary excretion . Strategies take account multi-level nature problem poor nutrition among low income African Americans need improve adherence dietary recommendation reverse micronutrient deficiency hypertensive adult . The Five Plus Nuts & Beans Study randomize , control trial compare two strategy translate result DASH ( Dietary Approaches Stop Hypertension ) Study practice 120 African American participant stable dos antihypertensive medication . The first arm study offer minimal DASH-oriented dietary advice along food credit local supermarket make decision eat . The second arm consist single one-hour session nutrition expert provide choice place on-line order community grocery store ( Santoni 's Market ) target purchase fruit , vegetable , nut bean . Following initial contact , weekly call coordinator $ 30 per week food delivery . Food order deliver pick-up weekly participant Baltimore Public Library participant 's neighborhood . Our primary outcome change blood pressure 8 week . Secondary outcome effect glucose , uric acid , urine potassium excretion , self-report consumption fruit vegetable period . After completion active phase trial , follow blood pressure electronic medical record one year assess long-term effect .
DOC.criteria: must age 21 old , diagnosis hypertension prehypertension regular care physician , compliant medication . systolic blood pressure 120140 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure 8090 mmHg ( average two visit ) stable dos antihypertensive medication minimum two month prior randomization , ( duration study ) . able follow trial procedure . cardiovascular event within 6 month , chronic disease might interfere trial participation ( e.g . chronic kidney disease ( estimate GFR < 60 cc/min ) , unwillingness inability adopt DASHlike diet , consumption 14 alcoholic drink per week , poorly control diabetes ( Hemoglobin A1c > 9 % ) , use insulin , use mineral supplement unwillingness stop supplement one month prior randomization refrain supplement study .
